reference: BEHRMAN, J. R., M. R. ROSENZWEIG, AND P. TAUBMAN (1996): College Choice and Wages: Estimates Using Data on Female Twins, Review of Economics and Statistics, LXXXVII, 672- 68S. 26 Not all students are required to take a foreign language and students are spread across foreign language courses in Spanish, French, German, Russian, Chinese, Japanese, and Arabic. Given this, the likelihood of finding a suitable study partner within a given squadron is much smaller than for other freshman courses, which have near universal common enrollment.
